Detailed Description

Abstract class DataConn is the base class of data connections. It is implemented as a well-defined state machine and thereby defines the states a data connection can be in.

Member Typedef Documentation

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum DataConn::DataConnState [protected]
 

Enumeration of states of a data connection. State enumeration order must match the order of state method entries in the state map.

enum DataConn::MessageType [protected]
 

Enumerator:
mt_data_conn_init  Message to send when data connection setup starts.
mt_data_conn_established  Message to send when data connection is established.
mt_data_conn_setup_failed  Message to send when data connection setup failed.
mt_data_conn_init_release  Message to send when data connection release starts.
mt_data_conn_released  Message to send when data connection is released.
mt_data_conn_setup_blocked  Message to send when data connection setup is blocked.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DataConn::DataConn (  const DataConnProfilePtr &  profile  )  [protected]
 

Creates a data connection which uses profile on setup. The given profile smart pointer must be valid, otherwise an assertion holds.

Member Function Documentation

void DataConn::BearerDisconnectedEvent (  SocketControlMsgType  error_msg  )  [protected]
 

To be called when the data connection bearer is asynchronously disconnected.

virtual BOOLEAN DataConn::CancelSetup (   )  [inline, protected, virtual]
 

This method is called when a data connection shall be canceled during the setup phase. Derived classes can override this method to immediately stop the setup process. This is especially needed if the setup process might take a long time. If this method is not overridden then the data connection continues the setup process completely but then immediately shuts it down again since a cancel request was issued during the setup process.

Returns:
Tells if the cancellation was done.

Reimplemented in PppDataConn.

BOOLEAN DataConn::CheckCancelRequest (  BOOLEAN  internal = FALSE  )  [protected]
 

Checks if the user canceled the data connection and triggers a release in case. Argument internal tells if the method is called from an internal state.

Returns:
Tells if cancel was requested.

void DataConn::CheckTimers (   )  [protected]
 

Checks if any timer flags have been set. In case a flag has been set the respective callback is called.

void DataConn::Cleanup (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Cleans up the internals to virginal state.

Reimplemented in CsdDataConn, PppDataConn, and PsdDataConn.

virtual BOOLEAN DataConn::DataConnIsBlocked (   )  const [inline, protected, virtual]
 

If there are some special conditions which block the data connection from being setup, override this method and return TRUE in case. You also have to post a DataConnInfoMsg indicating the reason for blocking in order to inform the context for it can react accordingly.

Reimplemented in PsdDataConn.

virtual void DataConn::DoRelease (   )  [protected, pure virtual]
 

Asynchronous data connection release request.

Implemented in PppDataConn, and PsdDataConn.

virtual void DataConn::DoSetup (   )  [protected, pure virtual]
 

Asynchronous data connection setup request.

Implemented in PppDataConn, and PsdDataConn.

virtual BOOLEAN DataConn::GetIpAddress (  IpAddr &  addr  )  const [pure virtual]
 

Retrieves the IP address that is currently assigned to this data connection. If the connection is not setup and running and hence no address can be retrieved then FALSE will be returned.

Implemented in PppDataConn, and PsdDataConn.

UINT8 DataConn::GetNsapi (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns the network service access point identifier (NSAPI). If the data connection doesn't supply one, an invalid NSAPI value is returned.

Reimplemented in PsdDataConn.

const IpAddr& DataConn::GetPrimaryDnsServerAddress (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the IP address of the used primary DNS server. This is either the one defined in the profile or if it was 0.0.0.0 before, then it's the automatically assigned one.

DataConnProfilePtr DataConn::GetProfile (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the profile of the data connection.

DataConnProfile::ProfileType DataConn::GetProfileType (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the profile type of the data connection.

const IpAddr& DataConn::GetSecondaryDnsServerAddress (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the IP address of the used secondary DNS server. This is either the one defined in the profile or if it was 0.0.0.0 before, then it's the automatically assigned one.

SocketData& DataConn::GetSocketData (   )  const [inline, protected]
 

Returns the socket data that triggered the data connection setup.

DataConn::DataConnState DataConn::GetState (   )  const [protected]
 

Returns the current state of the data connection.

void DataConn::Init (   )  [inline, protected]
 

This method initializes the freshly constructed data connection by executing CleanUp(). This method has to be called after the object has been constructed.

void DataConn::InvalidateSockets (   )  const [protected]
 

Invalidates all attached socket datas. For each socket data

  • the error code m_socket_err is set and
  • the socket control error message m_ctrl_err_msg is sent to its owning context.

BOOLEAN DataConn::IsActive (   )  const [inline]
 

Tells if the data connection is active, i.e. the connection is established and it is used by at least one attached socket.

BOOLEAN DataConn::IsCancelled (   )  const
 

Tells if the data connection was canceled, i.e. if the client called Release() during data connection setup.

BOOLEAN DataConn::IsConnected (   )  const [inline]
 

Tells if the data connection is connected, i.e. the connection is established and can be used for communication.

BOOLEAN DataConn::IsDisconnected (   )  const [inline]
 

Tells if the data connection is disconnected, i.e. the connection is closed and cannot be used for communication.

BOOLEAN DataConn::IsInactive (   )  const [inline]
 

Tells if the data connection is inactive, i.e. the data connection is idle and disconnected.

BOOLEAN DataConn::IsInHold (   )  const [inline]
 

Tells if the data connection is in hold, i.e. the connection is established, however, currently no socket is attached to it.

BOOLEAN DataConn::IsInRelease (   )  const [inline]
 

Tells if the data connection is currently being released, i.e. the data connection link is getting closed.

BOOLEAN DataConn::IsInSetup (   )  const [inline]
 

Tells if the data connection is currently being set up, i.e. the data connection link is getting established.

const DataConnProfile& DataConn::MyProfile (   )  const [inline, protected]
 

Reimplemented in CsdDataConn, and PsdDataConn.

void DataConn::PostDataConnControlMsg (  const DataConnCtrlCb  cb  )  [protected]
 

virtual void DataConn::PostInfoMsg (  MessageType  type  )  const [protected, pure virtual]
 

void DataConn::PostSocketControlMsg (  SocketControlMsgType  control_type  )  [protected]
 

Posts the socket control message control_type to the socket data that triggered the currently running setup or release process if a valid context is connected to it. If the current action was not triggered by a socket data but for example by a timeout, then nothing is sent.

void DataConn::PostSocketControlMsg (  SocketData &  sd,
SocketControlMsgType  control_type
)  [static, protected]
 

Posts the socket control message control_type to socket data sd if a valid context is connected to it.

BOOLEAN DataConn::Release (  BOOLEAN  block = FALSE  ) 
 

Trigger the release of the data connection independent of any socket data. The release of the data connection can run in blocking or non-blocking mode, parameter block specifies the desired execution mode. The return value states if the release has really been started. The release can't be started either on an out of memory condition or if the data connection is not active or currently gets released already.

Returns:
Tells if the data connection release could be started.

BOOLEAN DataConn::Release (  SocketData &  sd  ) 
 

Socket data sd requests to release the data connection. This method does not block, it triggers the release and returns immediately. The data connection release can't be started only on an out of memory condition.

Parameters:
sd Socket data which triggers the release request.
Returns:
Tells if the data connection release could be started.

void DataConn::ReleasedEvent (   )  [protected]
 

To be called when the data connection is released, either successfully or not.

void DataConn::ResetIdleTimer (   ) 
 

Resets the idle timer. If there is activity on an associated socket then the idle timer of the data connection shall be reset.

void DataConn::SetPrimaryDnsServerAddress (  const IpAddr &  primary_dns_addr  )  [inline, protected]
 

Sets the IP address of the primary DNS server to be used.

void DataConn::SetSecondaryDnsServerAddress (  const IpAddr &  secondary_dns_addr  )  [inline, protected]
 

Sets the IP address of the secondary DNS server to be used.

BOOLEAN DataConn::Setup (   ) 
 

Trigger the setup of the data connection independent of any socket data. This method blocks till the setup has either succeeded or failed.

Returns:
Success of data connection setup.

BOOLEAN DataConn::Setup (  SocketData &  sd  ) 
 

Socket data sd requests to setup the data connection. If the data connection can't be setup, the reason for the problem is provided as error code in sd. This method blocks till the setup has either succeeded or failed.

Parameters:
sd Socket data which triggers the setup request.
Returns:
Success of data connection setup.

BOOLEAN DataConn::SetupContext (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

This method is called immediately before DoSetup() is called in order to prepare the environment for the asynchronous setup request.

Returns:
Success of setting up the environment.

void DataConn::SetupFailedEvent (  SocketControlMsgType  error_msg  )  [protected]
 

To be called when the data connection setup process failed.

void DataConn::SetupSucceededEvent (   )  [protected]
 

To be called when the data connection setup process succeeds.

BOOLEAN DataConn::TeardownContext (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

This method is called immediately after DoRelease() or after a SetupFailedEvent() has been called due to a failed setup request in order to cleanup the environment.

Returns:
Success of tearing down the environment.

BOOLEAN DataConn::WaitForSetup (  SocketData &  sd  )  [protected]
 

Waits for the setup process to be completed and returns its success. If setup was not successful then the according error code is set to sd.

Returns:
Success of data connection setup.
